Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with healthy, green leaves when it has enough water.
The student can draw a plant with brown, wilted leaves when it does not have enough water.
The student can illustrate the difference between a plant with and without water using noticeable changes in the plant's appearance.
The student can show that plants need water to live and grow by comparing their pictures of plants with and without water.
The student can visually represent patterns observed in plants based on their access to water.
